name: Dummy.js
tagline: A simple, no-nonsense library for injecting dummy text in web pages.
body:
# Dummy.js ## Introduction Dummy.js is a simple, no-nonsense library for injecting dummy text in html pages. It is extremely easy to start using Dummy.js. It is as easy as adding a script tag at the end of your body and adding an attribute to the elements you want dummy text in. I found it very cumbersome working with dummy text while designing web pages. In order to fix this issue for myself and all those facing it, I wrote this library. ## Getting Started Download the code from [github](https://github.com/shreyasminocha/Dummy.js) and use it like this: ```html

... ``` There! Dummy.js is at your service. Here's a [working demo(broken at the moment)](https://github.com/shreyasminocha/Dummy.js#). ## CDN This section will be updated once Dummy.js has an official CDN. ## Disable If you would like to disable Dummy.js, this can be done without removing it from your web page. ```html ``` ## Upcoming In the upcoming versions, we're planning to add a configuration flow. For example, the you'd be able to configure the number of words in a sentence in a paragraph; unlike what's the case right now. ## Code You can find the code for this library on [github](https://github.com/shreyasminocha/Dummy.js). You are more than welcome to fork the source code and contribute to the library. Thanks! ## Thanks I would like to thank all those who have taken the time to contribute to this library by fixing bugs, contributing code, or spreading the word.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
